options.content: Compensate for variations in the relative positions of the differential and the wheels which result from bumpy road surface or other similar driving conditions.

options.label: B
options.content: Absorb any difference in speed between the left and right wheels when the vehicle is turning.

options.label: C
options.content: Absorb the vibrations transferred from the surface of the road

Which of the following statement is correct?

options.label: A
options.content: When the driver releases the clutch pedal, the spring pressure inside the pressure plate pushes forward on the clutch disc, this locks the flywheel, disc, pressure plate, and transmission input together.

options.label: B
options.content: When the driver releases the clutch pedal, the clutch release mechanism pulls or pushes on the clutch fork the fork moves the release bearing into the center of the pressure plate, the pressure plate face pulls away from the clutch disc.

options.label: C
options.content: When the driver releases the clutch pedal, the clutch disc and transmission input does not turn together.

options.label: D
options.content: When the driver presses the clutch pedal, this mechanism is called clutch engaged.

content: Which of the following is a false statement? Consider manual transmission.

options.label: A
options.content: A small gear driving a larger gear increases torque and decreases speed output.

options.label: B
options.content: Gear reduction occurs when a small gear drives a larger gear.

options.label: C
options.content: Gear ratio Calculated by dividing the number of teeth on the drive gear by the number of teeth on the driven gear.

options.label: D
options.content: Overdrive Ratio results when a larger gear drives a smaller gear.

content: Which one is false statement based on the assumption of air standard engine cycle?

options.content: Compression strokes and expansion strokes are approximated by isentropic processes

options.label: C
options.content: Exhaust blow down is approximated by a constant-volume process
